definitions.definition: To mark or number the pages of, as a book or manuscript.
(often with “through”) To turn several pages of a publication.
definitions.example: The patient paged through magazines while he waited for the doctor.

definitions.definition: To contact (someone) by means of a pager or other mobile device.
definitions.example: I’ll be out all day, so page me if you need me.

definitions.definition: To call (somebody) using a public address system so as to find them.
definitions.example: An SUV parked me in. Could you please page its owner?
